body:
> I can also try to isolate this to a non-Keycloak quarkus project if needed.

That would indeed make it much easier for us to verify any potential fixes

issue.title: Try to recover from logging errors when closing application

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body: A basic attempt of doing a little better can be found in https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/45713

I think the main bug to fix here would be that `OpenContainerPathTree` (and the call stack leading up to it) should not produce an NPE under any circumstance. Secondarily, the delayed queue handler should produce a error handler record if formatting fails instead of propagating the exception.

The idea of nulling things is that we should avoid loading classes from closed class loaders. In the end, we would have liked throwing an error when it happens. 

So ideally I would prefer if we dumped the logs before we close the CL. But I havenâ€™t looked at the code at all.

issue.title: Fix PathTreeClassPathElement#toString() implementation

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

issue.body:
It was relying on some internal behavior of the path trees and not calling the `getOriginalTree()` method.
But rather than fixing it this way, I think it's more future proof to properly implement `toString()` in the `PathTree` implementations.

Fixes #45650

body:
@shawkins could you check if https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/45799 fixes your issue?

I'm all for including the patch from @geoand too but this should be the proper fix for your problem.

@gsmet with your path applied the delayed logging closure now shows:

Then keycloak emits an error related to the underlying problem because we're catching the actual exception:

```
ERROR: org.keycloak.authentication.AuthenticatorFactory: Provider org.keycloak.examples.authenticator.SecretQuestionAuthenticatorFactory could not be instantiated
ERROR: org/keycloak/examples/authenticator/SecretQuestionAuthenticator
ERROR: org.keycloak.examples.authenticator.SecretQuestionAuthenticator
```

This seems good to me.
